name: Baby Milk Action IBFAN UK
legal: Non Profit Company Limited by Guarantee
goal:
Baby Milk Action, as part of a global network, acts to stop misleading marketing by the baby feeding industry. We protect breastfeeding and babies fed on formula to prevent unnecessary death and suffering.

The global network is called IBFAN (the International Baby Food Action Network) a network of over 270 citizens groups in more than 160 countries.
interests: Climate Action, Consumer Affairs, Development, Education, Environment, External Relations, Food Safety, Humanitarian Aid, Internal Market, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Public Health, Research and Technology, Trade, Youth
euInitiatives:
EU legislation on the marketing of baby foods
EU Legislation on the marketing of processed foods
European Platform for Diet Physical Activity and Health
EU legislation on Transparency, conflicts of Interest, food safety,EFSA
EU Development policies.
EU Trade policies, including at Codex
EU UN relations
Humanitarian aid
Human Rights
Corporate Accountability
